name: Tileable (Liberty Jones)
description:
This small world was calm, quiet, and peaceful, until one day, aliens attacked! But wait... the aliens are... frogs?!

Fly a UFO around the map;
Build a froggy empire by placing tiles;
Expand your territory and crush your opponent!



The game works by placing tiles onto a grid. Each tile has a corresponding use:
Farms: Used to create food for your army.
Roads: Used to expand and connect your villages.
Villages: Complete villages to score points.

Each piece that has a road must be connected to another piece that also has a road. The roads must connect together; so you can't connect a road to an empty piece of land, for example. The same goes for village tiles; a village has to connect to another village.

Each turn, the player has 10 seconds to complete the turn. If the player takes longer, they lose the point.

You score points for every completed city you have. If you have more points than your opponent at the end, you win.

Now get out there, amass your froggy army, and defeat your opponent!

Platform: Windows

Ethan Corbett: 3D Environment Art

Controls (Mouse + Keyboard / Controller) :

Move UFO: Mouse / Joystick
Place tile: Mouse click / A button
Skip turn: Mouse click / Y button
Change card: Up + Down arrow keys / Right + left Bumper

Install Instructions (Windows):

Download and extract the .ZIP file somewhere onto your computer, then double click "CC22-FroggyHat.exe".

Important note:

When the game begins, click "Next Turn" to begin playing.
